@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This class is responsible for converting json data to class instances
including the creation of the classes.
To retrieve the native data of created models use the methods
described in {@link qx.util.Serializer}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
delegate {Object} An object containing one of the methods described
in {@link qx.data.marshal.IMarshalerDelegate}.
@param.description:
An object containing one of the methods described
in {@link qx.data.marshal.IMarshalerDelegate}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Converts a given object into a hash which will be used to identify the classes under the namespace qx.data.model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
data {Object} The JavaScript object from which the hash is
required.
@param.description:
The JavaScript object from which the hash is
required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
includeBubbleEvents {Boolean?false} Whether the model should
support the bubbling of change events or not.
@param.description:
Whether the model should
support the bubbling of change events or not.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The hash representation of the given JavaScript object.
@return.desc: The hash representation of the given JavaScript object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the "most enhanced" hash for a given object.  That is the hash for
the class that is most feature rich in respect of the bubble event
feature. If there are two equal classes available (defined), one with
and one without the bubble event feature, this method will return the
hash of the class that includes the bubble event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
data {Object} The JavaScript object from which the hash is
required.
@param.description:
The JavaScript object from which the hash is
required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: includeBubbleEvents {Boolean} Whether the preferred model should support the bubbling of change events or not. If null, an automatic selection will take place which selects the "best" model currently available.
@param.description: Whether the preferred model should support the bubbling of change events or not. If null, an automatic selection will take place which selects the "best" model currently available.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The hash representation of the given JavaScript object.
@return.desc: The hash representation of the given JavaScript object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates for the given data the needed classes. The classes contain for every key in the data a property. The classname is always the prefix qx.data.model and the hash of the data created by {@link #__jsonToHash}. Two objects containing the same keys will not create two different classes. The class creation process also supports the functions provided by its delegate. Important, please keep in mind that only valid JavaScript identifiers can be used as keys in the data map. For convenience '-' in keys will be removed (a-b will be ab in the end).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Object} The object for which classes should be created.
@param.description: The object for which classes should be created.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
includeBubbleEvents {Boolean} Whether the model should support
the bubbling of change events or not.
@param.description:
Whether the model should support
the bubbling of change events or not.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Object} The object for which classes should be created.
@param.description: The object for which classes should be created.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
includeBubbleEvents {Boolean} Whether the model should support
the bubbling of change events or not.
@param.description:
Whether the model should support
the bubbling of change events or not.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
parentProperty {String|null} The name of the property the
data will be stored in.
@param.description:
The name of the property the
data will be stored in.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: depth {Number} The depth of the data relative to the data's root.
@param.description: The depth of the data relative to the data's root.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper for disposing items of the created class.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {var} The item to dispose.
@param.description: The item to dispose.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates an instance for the given data hash.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hash {String} The hash of the data for which an instance should
be created.
@param.description:
The hash of the data for which an instance should
be created.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
parentProperty {String|null} The name of the property the data
will be stored in.
@param.description:
The name of the property the data
will be stored in.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: depth {Number} The depth of the object relative to the data root.
@param.description: The depth of the object relative to the data root.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map} The data for which an instance should be created.
@param.description: The data for which an instance should be created.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object} An instance of the corresponding class.
@return.desc: An instance of the corresponding class.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper to decide if the delegate decides to ignore a data set.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hash {String} The property names.
@param.description: The property names.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
parentProperty {String|null} The name of the property the data
will be stored in.
@param.description:
The name of the property the data
will be stored in.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: depth {Number} The depth of the object relative to the data root.
@param.description: The depth of the object relative to the data root.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the set should be ignored
@return.desc: true if the set should be ignored

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Creates for the given data the needed models. Be sure to have the classes
created with {@link #toClass} before calling this method. The creation
of the class itself is delegated to the {@link #__createInstance} method,
which could use the {@link qx.data.store.IStoreDelegate} methods, if
given.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Object} The object for which models should be created.
@param.description: The object for which models should be created.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: includeBubbleEvents {Boolean?null} Whether the model should support the bubbling of change events or not. If omitted or null, an automatic selection will take place which selects the "best" model currently available.
@param.description: Whether the model should support the bubbling of change events or not. If omitted or null, an automatic selection will take place which selects the "best" model currently available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Object} The object for which models should be created.
@param.description: The object for which models should be created.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: includeBubbleEvents {Boolean|null} Whether the model should support the bubbling of change events or not. If null, an automatic selection will take place which selects the "best" model currently available.
@param.description: Whether the model should support the bubbling of change events or not. If null, an automatic selection will take place which selects the "best" model currently available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
parentProperty {String|null} The name of the property the
data will be stored in.
@param.description:
The name of the property the
data will be stored in.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: depth {Number} The depth of the data relative to the data's root.
@param.description: The depth of the data relative to the data's root.
